org.ndnx.ndn.impl.encoding
Class GenericXMLEncodable

java.lang.Object
  org.ndnx.ndn.impl.encoding.GenericXMLEncodable
All Implemented Interfaces:
XMLEncodable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AccessControlPolicyMarker, Collection, ConfigSlice, ContentName, ContentObject, Exclude, Exclude.Element, FaceManager.FaceInstance, Header, Interest, KeyLocator, KeyName, KeyValuePair, KeyValueSet, Link, LinkAuthenticator, ParameterizedName, PolicyXML, PrefixRegistrationManager.ForwardingEntry, PublisherID, PublisherPublicKeyDigest, RepositoryInfo, Signature, SignedInfo, SyncNodeComposite, SyncNodeComposite.SyncNodeElement, WrappedKey
public abstract class GenericXMLEncodable
extends Object
implements XMLEncodable

Implementation of generic XML encode/decode functionality for objects. Subclasses will be capable of being encoded to and decoded from both normal text-based XML and the ndnb compact binary encoding. (Though a subclass could mandate only one be used, or a caller can choose to specify. It is useful, for example, to use this approach to write classes that can be encoded & decoded to & from user-editable text XML only. See GenericXMLEncodable#toString() for an example.) This class handles most of the generic methods required by XMLEncodable, leaving only a very small number that subclasses need to actually implement.

See Also:
XMLEncodable

Constructor Detail

GenericXMLEncodable

protected GenericXMLEncodable()
All subclasses should provide a public no-argument constructor to be used by decoding methods. Don't provide a constructor that takes a byte[]. A class with no subclasses will decode fine, but its subclasses won't have their members set up to accept the data yet and so bad things will happen. (And even if you don't see why anyone would need to subclass your type, someone else might.) Clients wishing to decode content will call the no-argument constructor first, and then call decode(InputStream) or decode(ByteBuffer).

Decode this object as the top-level item in a new XML document, reading it from an InputStream. Reads document start and end. Assumes default encoding.

toString

public String toString()
Default toString() implementation simply prints the text encoding of the object. This demonstrates how to force use of the text encoding.

Overrides:
toString in class Object

decode

public abstract void decode(XMLDecoder decoder)
                     throws ContentDecodingException
Description copied from interface: XMLEncodable
Decode this object during an ongoing decoding pass; this is what subclasses generally need to know how to implement. Reads just the object itself, higher-level processes have handled start and end document if need be. Allows object to be read using the same code whether it is a top-level element written alone, or nested inside another element.

Specified by:
decode in interface XMLEncodable
Parameters:
decoder - the decoder being used; encapsulates state including the codec being used as well as the input source and current offset
Throws:
ContentDecodingException

encode

public abstract void encode(XMLEncoder encoder)
                     throws ContentEncodingException
Description copied from interface: XMLEncodable
Encode this object during an ongoing encoding pass; this is what subclasses generally need to know how to implement. Writes just the object itself, higher-level processes have handled start and end document if need be. Allows object to be written using the same code whether it is a top-level element written alone, or nested inside another element.

Specified by:
encode in interface XMLEncodable
Parameters:
encoder - the encoder being used; encapsulates state including the codec being used as well as the output destination and current offset
Throws:
ContentEncodingException

getElementLabel

public abstract long getElementLabel()
Description copied from interface: XMLEncodable
Allow the encoder/decoder to retrieve the top-level element name programmatically. This allows subclasses to rename elements without changing their encoder/decoders.

Specified by:
getElementLabel in interface XMLEncodable
Returns:
the element label to use, as a key in a loaded encoding dictionary

validate

public abstract boolean validate()
Description copied from interface: XMLEncodable
Make sure all of the necessary fields are filled in prior to attempting to encode. All implementations of encode(XMLEncoder) should call this for their classes prior to encoding.

Specified by:
validate in interface XMLEncodable
Returns:
true if object is valid and can be encoded, false if there is a problem; for example mandatory fields are uninitialized
